id: bigtech:elon musk accused of making up math to squeeze 134b from ope:2026-01-19T19:04:18.000Z
title: Elon Musk accused of making up math to squeeze $134B from OpenAI, Microsoft
author: Ashley Belanger
summary_long: Elon Musk is going for some substantial damages in his lawsuit accusing OpenAI of abandoning its nonprofit mission and "making a fool out of him" as an early investor. On Friday, Musk filed a notice on remedies sought in the lawsuit, confirming that he's seeking damages between $79 billion and $134 billion from OpenAI and its largest backer, co-defendant Microsoft. Musk hired an expert he has never used before, C. Paul Wazzan, who reached this estimate by concluding that Musk's early contributions to OpenAI generated 50 to 75 percent of the nonprofit's current value. Source: arstechnica.com. Date: 2026-01-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: bigtech:the fastest human spaceflight mission in history crawls clos:2026-01-19T22:01:52.000Z
title: The fastest human spaceflight mission in history crawls closer to liftoff
author: Stephen Clark
summary_long: KENNEDY SPACE CENTER, Florida—Preparations for the first human spaceflight to the Moon in more than 50 years took a big step forward this weekend with the rollout of the Artemis II rocket to its launch pad. The rocket reached a top speed of just 1 mph on the four-mile, 12-hour journey from the Vehicle Assembly Building to Launch Complex 39B at NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida. At the end of its nearly 10-day tour through cislunar space, the Orion capsule on top of the rocket will exceed 25,000 mph as it plunges into the atmosphere to bring its four-person crew back to Earth. "This is the start of a very long journey," said NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman. Source: arstechnica.com. Date: 2026-01-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: bigtech:threads overtakes x on mobile but still lags far behind:2026-01-19T11:53:33.000Z
title: Threads overtakes X on mobile, but still lags far behind
author: Jess Weatherbed
summary_long: After launching almost three years ago, Meta's Threads is now reportedly attracting more daily mobile users than rival platform X. According to Similarweb data shared by TechCrunch, Threads has 141.5 million daily active iOS and Android global app users as of January 7th, compared to 125 million users for Elon Musk's mobile platform. Similarweb reports that Threads actually overtook X sometime between late October and early November after a consistent period of growth, meaning this milestone wasn't suddenly achieved in reaction to recent Grok-related controversies. X still has more mobile users than Threads in the US, according to Similarwe … Read the full story at The Verge. Source: www.theverge.com. Date: 2026-01-19. id: consumer:asus will not release any new smartphones this year:2026-01-19T21:30:43.000Z
title: ASUS will not release any new smartphones this year
author: Anna Washenko
summary_long: ASUS appears to be shifting its business operations away from smartphones. According to translations of recent quotes from Chairman Jonney Shih, the company does not plan to release new phone models in the future. The chairman did not confirm whether smartphones would be completely phased out, but he did acknowledge that possibility. Whatever direction ASUS takes, its existing phones will continue to receive software updates and warranty assistance. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2026-01-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:musk claims tesla will restart work on its dojo supercompute:2026-01-19T17:31:27.000Z
title: Musk claims Tesla will restart work on its Dojo supercomputer
author: Andre Revilla
summary_long: Elon Musk posted on X that Tesla will be restarting work on Dojo3, the third generation of its in-house supercomputer project. The Dojo team had been disbanded last year as the company prioritized the AI chips that run on board Tesla vehicles. Musk said the company is returning to the project "now that the AI5 chip design is in good shape." The purpose of the Dojo project is to process video recordings and other data from Tesla vehicles and use that to train the "neural net" behind the company's Full Self-Driving software. Last year, however, Musk posted on X that "It doesn’t make sense for Tesla to divide its resources and scale two quite different AI chip designs. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2026-01-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

title: Trump is winning the fight against offshore wind despite court losses

id: consumer:threads has more global daily users than x on mobile for the:2026-01-19T14:49:36.000Z
title: Threads has more global daily users than X on mobile for the first time
author: Andre Revilla
summary_long: Meta’s Threads is pulling further ahead of Elon Musk’s X on mobile, based on recent estimates from analytics firm Similarweb, Forbes reports. In the first stretch of January, Threads averaged roughly 143 million daily active users worldwide on mobile devices, compared with about 126 million for X. Similarweb’s year-over-year snapshot shows Threads growing sharply, up 37.8 percent year-over-year, while X’s daily mobile audience fell 11.9 percent across the same period. The picture is more mixed in the US, where X still holds a narrow edge on mobile. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2026-01-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.
